title: How Many Calories in Half of a Banana?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in half of a banana, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, and easy tweaks for your snack.
h1: How Many Calories in Half of a Banana?
assumptions: Medium ripe banana (~118 g whole, peeled); half is ~59 g. No added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by banana size, ripeness, variety, and storage; values are averages. Check for allergies.

quick_answer.text: Half a medium banana provides ~53 kcal, mostly from natural sugars and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a whole medium banana?
faqs.a: About 105 kcal for one medium banana.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in half a banana?
faqs.a: Roughly 13.5 g carbs, including 1.6 g fiber and 7 g sugars.
Yes; small bananas have fewer calories (~63 kcal whole), large more (~121 kcal).
No, only ~0.7 g protein in half a banana; they're carb-focused.

faqs.q: How does ripeness change banana calories?
faqs.a: Riper bananas have slightly more calories due to starch turning to sugars, but difference is minimal (~5-10 kcal).
